description.narrative: NG Sensors BV (founded in 2017) is a technology company focused on the development and now the commercialization of the Handheld Molecular Contaminant Screener (HMCS) to enhance food safety and reduce food waste during the food processing process. NG Sensors applied its proprietary mass spectrometer (MS)-based technology to develop the Handheld Molecular Contaminants Screener (HMCS), a portable and user-friendly device to assess a wide range of parameters, on-site (at the source) and in real-time (without time delay) that can affect the water quality in aquaculture. In India the devices will be installed and demonstrated on-site at ponds for the entire shrimp culture cycle in Andhra Pradesh which ranks the highest in terms of shrimp cultivation and second highest in India in terms of the estimated brackish water area suitable for Aquaculture. The HMCS will also be demonstrated at a processing facility in Kerala to show that it is a valuable instrument to improve quality control and food safety in the processing facilities. Contamination assessment with HMCS is cost-effective and timesaving compared to current lab-based testing. Subsequently, HMCS enables faster detection of parameters and contaminations and therefore the fisheries can take pro-active action to reduce down the food waste while improving food safety along with a significant contribution to the reduction of CO2 emissions by food/feed companies.
